an6.83:4.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.
an6.83:4.3: It’s when a mendicant is faithless, shameless, imprudent, lazy, and witless. And they’re concerned with their body and their life.
an6.83:4.4: A mendicant with these six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.
an6.83:5.1: A mendicant with six qualities can realize the best thing, perfection.
an6.83:5.3: It’s when a mendicant is faithful, conscientious, prudent, energetic, and wise. And they have no concern for their body and their life.
an6.83:5.4: A mendicant with these six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.”
